TextFlow.p: If your main story is told in the past tense, anything that happened before that time should be in the past perfect tense.
He had been to London before, but this time everything was different.
Anything that happens after the main story will be in a future tense such as past continuous (with “going to”) or would:
She was going to stay with her father for a couple of weeks.

TextFlow.p: If your main story is in the present or the future, then all verb tenses must change to agree with the time of the story.
After main story: was/were + going to or would (or present/future)
